docs.abstract: From the NYT: It is never a good thing if many of your customers can no longer afford what you are selling. The UnitedHealth Group, which announced disappointing first-quarter earnings on Tuesday, said the weakening economy was causing fewer businesses and employees to sign up for its health insurance. UnitedHealth, whose stock fell sharply on [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 800,000 Americans got Lasik surgery in 2007, but the numbers started slumping last year.

headline.main: As Economy Slows, So Do Laser Eye Surgeries
headline.print_headline: As Economy Slows, So Do Laser Eye Surgeries

docs.lead_paragraph: The UnitedHealth Group posted lower-than-expected first-quarter earnings and sharply reduced its outlook for 2008, saying fewer businesses and employees were signing up.

headline.main: Insurer Says Economy Has Dented Its Prospects
headline.print_headline: Insurer Says Economy Has Dented Its Prospects

docs.snippet: The UnitedHealth Group posted lower-than-expected first-quarter earnings and sharply reduced its outlook for 2008, saying fewer businesses and employees were signing up.

headline.print_headline: Letter; Snags in Social Safety Net

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers are close to an agreement to clear the way for a bill prohibiting employers and insurers from discriminating on the basis of genetic tests.

headline.main: Congress Near Deal on Genetic Test Bias Bill
headline.print_headline: Genetic-Discrimination Ban Moves Ahead in Congress

docs.snippet: Lawmakers are close to an agreement to clear the way for a bill prohibiting employers and insurers from discriminating on the basis of genetic tests.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Workers Get Fewer Hours, Deepening the Downturn'' (front page, April 18) highlighted an important dynamic of the current economic slowdown. Reducing hours to control labor costs makes sense for firms, and is sometimes preferable to formal layoffs for workers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pain doesn't show up on a body scan and can't be measured in a test. As a result, many chronic pain sufferers turn to art, opting to paint, draw or sculpt images in an effort to depict their pain.
docs.abstract: From Frida Kahlo to the Pain Exhibit, artists paint, draw and sculpt to express their pain.
docs.snippet: From Frida Kahlo to the Pain Exhibit, artists paint, draw and sculpt to express their pain.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Bush renewed his criticism of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi for blocking the Colombia free trade agreement.
